content2.title: Production Well Casing Integrity Verification To Prevent Leaks

subtitle.text: Dexon’s Production Well Casing In-Line Inspection program offers comprehensive anomaly detection and sizing utilizing ultrasonic technology. Advanced sensors provide direct pipe thickness data for precision measurement of corrosion and anomalies to 1.0 mm remaining wall thickness. Bidirectional tool operation guarantees high density sampling rates for each casing, ensuring 100% probability of detection of critical defects and extremely thin piping. On-site field reporting of thin and corroded piping provides actionable information, reducing the risk of downtime. Detailed final reporting provides data for continued operations and scheduled maintenance, to ensure efficient, profitable, and safe operation. Dexon ultrasonic multichannel transducer configurations offers quick inspection speed, reducing downtime and resulting in increased productivity

Bi-directional tool operation guarantees high-density sampling rates for each casing, ensuring 100% probability of detection of critical defects and extremely thin piping. Immediate on-site field reporting of thin and corroded piping provides actionable information, reducing downtime.
Detailed final reporting provides data for continued operations and scheduled maintenance, to ensure efficient, profitable, and safe operation.
Dexon’s ultrasonic multi-channel transducer configurations offer quick inspection speed, reducing downtime and resulting in increased productivity.

content3.title: Threats To Production Well Casing Strings

subtitle.text: Water used in hydraulic fracturing (produced water) contains potentially dangerous chemicals such as naturally occurring hydrocarbons, radioactive materials, metal ions, and additives that pose threats to the environment. Leaks in the intermediate casing zone allows these chemicals to enter and contaminate groundwater.

Leaks may occur when groundwater seeps through the cement lining and settles on production casing strings, resulting in critical defects forming between the production casing and the cement lining, with the potential to contaminate groundwater. Dexon’s Production Well In-Line Inspection program offers comprehensive inspection and detection of defects and anomalies in casing strings that can lead to leaks.
Production wells are generally susceptible to the following anomalies occurring within the pipe wall
Uneven metal loss over a large area of the pipe wall
Localized corrosion producing holes (pits) in the pipe wall. Detection of pitting can be difficult with other technologies in providing correct and concise sizing of individual anomalies (pits

content4.title: Immediate Comprehensive Two-tiered Reporting
content4.subtitle: Dexon’s Production Well Casing In-Line Inspection (ILI) program guarantees asset integrity with a two-tiered reporting system supplying immediate information on the integrity of the well, clearing it for continued operation and getting it back online ASAP:

subtitle.text: Summary of important operational informatio
Receive accurate field reporting in as little as 2 hours providing instant analysis of all critical anomalies.t
Clearing the well for continued operation or allowing for immediate planning and running of casing  patches where necessary to keep the well online.
Summary of all inspection operating details.
Delivered within as little as 24 hours, including detailed analysis of anomalies.
Featuring certified expert assessment of well casing integrity including immediate threats to continued safe operation.
Detailed analysis for all well casing anomalies exceeding pre-determined severity criteria

card.title: Groundwater Zone
card.subtitle: The groundwater zone includes all geologic formations of soil, sand and rock containing groundwater that are susceptible to groundwater contamination

card.title: Inspection Zone
card.subtitle: The zone under inspection includes the entire casing string from the ‘Christmas Tree’ on the surface to the production zone.

card.title: Production Zone
card.subtitle: The production zone is the section of casing that is intentionally perforated to allow gases and liquids to flow through the intermediate casing to the surface for extraction. For this reason, the production zone does not require inspection

content5.title: High-resolution Production Well In-line Inspection Fleet
content5.subtitle: Dexon's high-resolution Production Well In-Line Inspection fleet takes the inspection process to new heights. The fleet features overlapping rows of ultrasonic transducers strategically positioned around the tool's circumference. Sampling density plays a pivotal role in the probability of anomaly detection, achieving more than 190,000 samples per m2 of pipe wall at a rapid speed of 20m/m. Capable of inspecting 500m of pipe every 25 minutes, allowing for the inspection of multiple wells per day per team. These higher inspection speeds result in significantly reduced well downtime, leading to cost savings, and increased well productivity.

subtitle.text: 1.5mm axial ultrasonic sampling resolution {'@'} 0.34m/s.
1.5mm circumferential ultrasonic sampling resolution.
190,476 raw direct measurement data samples per m2.
Bi-directional inspection.
24.5 minute inspection time per 500m.
160 ultrasonic transducers
Tool speed: 60m/min.
Final reporting in as little as 24 hours
The inspection fleet’s lightweight construction and design allow for easy mobility and handloading on slicklines
Providing accurate wall thickness measurements down to 1.0 mm in remaining wall thickness
Ultra-accurate wall thickness measurements to within 0.1 mm of remaining wall thickness
3D graphic visual representation of inspection data provides a clear overview of all anomalies for review.
Dexon’s R&D department includes 80+ personnel for the continual development and customization of inspection services to meet client requirements

content6.title: Defect Detection Verification
content6.subtitle: Ultrasonic inspection data provides direct measurement of defects including defect size, location, remaining wall thickness, and metal loss percentage. This data is used to accurately determine pipeline condition and to provide a calculated Estimated Repair Factor (ERF) of each individual defect, ensuring asset integrity.
